issue.title: Add GA event tracking for Enhanced Measurement.
issue.body:
## Feature Description

GA events should be added to keep track of Enhanced Meaurement interaction for users who have opted into the anonymous usage data reporting.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

The following GA events should be tracked for the given Enhanced Measurement actions. See the [GA events sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1eEuJ2ppVZuai1_hL77RA2vL7DUidM_qCnvTsjxZ_S4k/edit#gid=925918307&range=190:197).

Event Name | Category | Trigger | Condition
-- | -- | -- | --
activate_enhanced_measurement | {viewContext}_analytics |	click | User activates toggle to enable Enhanced Measurement 									
deactivate_enhanced_measurement | {viewContext}_analytics |	click | User deactivates toggle to disable Enhanced Measurement 									
view_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification |	element visibility | Enhanced Measurement activation notification appears on the SK dashboard									
confirm_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification | click | User clicks "Enable now" CTA in the dashboard banner 									
dismiss_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification | click | User clicks "Maybe later" on the banner									
click_learn_more_link | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification |	click | User clicks "Learn more" on the banner									
view_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-success | element visibility | Enhanced Measurement success banner appears on the SK dashboard									
confirm_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-success | click | User clicks "OK Got it" CTA in the dashboard banner 									

## Implementation Brief

* In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/common/EnhancedMeasurementSwitch.js`
  * Inside [`handleClick`](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/5aafc62bfa9449790264593dba048da530ee54a7/assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/common/EnhancedMeasurementSwitch.js#L58) callback function, depending if `isEnhancedMeasurementEnabled` is true or false, send `trackEvent` with event `activate_enhanced_measurement` or `deactivate_enhanced_measurement` with category from AC
* In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/dashboard/EnhancedMeasurementActivationBanner/index.js`
  * Add `useMount` hook, since banner will be always be visible on top of the page (in view), when available
    * Check if `! isTooltipVisible` to send `trackEvent` for `view_notification` with category `{viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification`
  * In `handleDismiss` callback, add `trackEvent` for `dismiss_notification` with category from AC
* In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/dashboard/EnhancedMeasurementActivationBanner/SetupBanner.js`
  * Add `trackEvent` for `confirm_notification` and category `{viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification`, to the `handleSubmitChanges` callback
  * Add `onLearnMoreClick` prop to the `BannerNotification` component, and create callback function that will send `trackEvent` for `click_learn_more_link ` with category from AC
* In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/dashboard/EnhancedMeasurementActivationBanner/SuccessBanner.js`
  * Add `useMount` hook, since this notification will mount only when setup is successful, and be in view (top of the page)
    * add `trackEvent` for `view_notification` with category `{viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-success`
  * In the [`onDismiss`](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/5aafc62bfa9449790264593dba048da530ee54a7/assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/dashboard/EnhancedMeasurementActivationBanner/SuccessBanner.js#L58-L62) callback block, send `trackEvent` for `confirm_notification` and category `{viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-success`

### Test Coverage

* No test updates needed

## QA Brief

* Follow QA briefs from #7459 and #7461 to get the "Enable enhanced measurement" toggle and the "Enable enhanced measurement" notification banner for your site.
* Ensure your Site Kit settings have "Send Analytics to Google" enabled (either during setup or in the Site Kit Settings).
* Using the Google Analytics Debugger plugin, verify that correct events are tracked as defined in AC.

## Changelog entry

* Add Analytics events for Enhanced Measurement features.

issue.title: Implement new design updates to Metrics Selection Panel
issue.body:
## Feature Description

The Figma design for KMW introduced a new iteration for the Metrics Selection Panel with the following notable changes:
1. Increased width in larger viewports.
2. Header and footer changes.

These new changes should be implemented in the application.

<details>
<summary>Here's a screenshot for reference (from Figma)</summary>

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/20284937/cab5ff15-5986-4f67-86d7-9a6ad13122c4)

</details>



---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

- The width of the Key Metrics Selection Panel should be changed to 530 pixels for larger viewports (in viewports smaller than 601px, it should automatically take the full-width like it does today).
- Footer changes:
  - The footer subtext `Set your personalized goals or deactivate this widget in Settings` should be removed.
  - The CTA buttons should be pushed to the right, and the metric count should be relocated from the header to the footer left (according to designs).
  - A new notification option should be added that sticks to the footer like the designs. The custom dimensions notification added in #7599 should be displayed according to the designs using this option.
- Header changes
  - Subtext should be added to the header under the heading that should say `Edit your personalized goals or deactivate this widget in <link>Settings</link>`. The link should navigate the user to the Site Kit Admin Settings.
 

## Implementation Brief

- In `assets/sass/components/global/_googlesitekit-side-sheet.scss`:
  - Set the width of `.googlesitekit-side-sheet` to `530px` for non-mobile viewports.
- In `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/MetricsSelectionPanel/Footer.js`:
  - Create a 2-column layout accommodating the actions to the right.
  - In the left column, render the selected metric count which can be found in `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/MetricsSelectionPanel/Header.js`.
  - Move the footer note to the `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/MetricsSelectionPanel/Header.js` component.
  - Add a new `div` for the optional notification that should be fixed to the footer. Relocate the custom dimension notification introduced in #7599 to this new `div`.
  - Style the footer and attached notification according to the Figma designs.
- In `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/MetricsSelectionPanel/Header.js`:
  - Replace the selected metric count with the footer note, but change the class name to something like `googlesitekit-km-selection-panel-header__note`. Change font styles accordingly.
- In `assets/sass/components/key-metrics/_googlesitekit-km-selection-panel.scss`:
  - Add any new necessary styles.
  - Remove any styles that get redundant due to the changes here.

### Test Coverage

- Update tests to change DOM location of targetted elements.
- Update VRT references.

## QA Brief

- Set up Site Kit.
- Enable the `userInput` and `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag.
- In the KMW setup CTA, choose to select your own metrics.
- Verify the metric selection panel appears according to the Figma designs with the AC satisfied.
- Check a metric tile that depends on custom dimensions, e.g. `Top categories by pageviews`. Verify that the notice appears according to the Figma designs.
- Verify that the flicker reported [here](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/issues/7704#issuecomment-1779021331) is fixed.
- Verify that the metric titles in the selection panel are perfectly aligned (center) with the checkboxes.

## Changelog entry

* Update Key Metrics selection panel design.

issue.title: Don't show the "Enable enhanced measurement" switch until an account has been selected in the setup flow.
issue.body:
## Feature Description

As discussed on [Slack](https://10up.slack.com/archives/CBKKQEBR9/p1698390004666189): In the setup flow, the "Enable enhanced measurement" switch and description should not appear until an account has been selected from the dropdown.

In other words, when the setup flow is in this state the switch shouldn't appear:

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/18395600/e1a8f592-9d01-4d41-8941-8189b98b0574)

This is to avoid the confusing UX as seen here whereby the toggle state changes when returning from the Create Account screen. It will also be consistent with the other controls on the page i.e. the property and data stream dropdowns which only appear when the account is selected.

https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/18395600/6a3f6566-3843-43b6-8d5f-d6b94412383c

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* In the setup flow, the "Enable enhanced measurement" switch and description should not appear until an account has been selected from the dropdown.

## Implementation Brief

Within `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/setup/SetupEnhancedMeasurementSwitch.js`:

- Check if the account ID is valid and return `null` if so, similar to the logic in `PropertySelect`:
https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/7e36531c945151f051d44ae37186fa685090ad85/assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/common/PropertySelect.js#L110-L111

### Test Coverage

* Add a test case covering the above to the tests for `SetupEnhancedMeasurementSwitch`.

## QA Brief

* <!-- One or more bullet points for how to test that the feature works as expected. -->

## Changelog entry

* <!-- One sentence summarizing the PR, to be used in the changelog. -->

issue.title: Create “Top categories by pageviews” key metric widget tile
issue.body:
## Feature Description

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/20284937/f7e39472-098e-4bd8-b5d1-7c7dcfdca277)
(screenshot for reference - see Figma for latest version)

A new key metric widget tile should be added for "Top categories by pageviews".

See:

1. [Table of metrics in design doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1htqStvvyXq_eg5GsHSbdBBgm4Tu_Z6KXsIOBfjWQ5oM/edit?resourcekey=0-Px-yDiCQOTz30DBKllhU3g#heading=h.5u6oy5c2u65e).
2. [List of metrics in PRD](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UZ2VXOxpsY3GiHgQncZIb73Uy-xVf15MWJi46QkK_X0/edit?resourcekey=0-dB9ROp2h3ZYhqoyYBMTzvw#bookmark=id.usf86uc2bsda).
3. [Figma designs](https://www.figma.com/file/CdtrHB0HAjfGRWTnTMMQI0/Key-Metrics?type=design&node-id=6273-60077&mode=design&t=jVtKY6g6XWmpvybS-4).

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

- A new component should be created for the "Top categories by pageviews" key metric widget tile and should be displayed within the Key Metrics Widget area if it is selected in the key metrics selection panel.
  - This metric tile should use the wrapper for tiles dependent on custom dimensions (being implemented in [#7601](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/issues/7601)).
  - When defining this metric tile in the `KEY_METRICS_WIDGETS` constant (located in `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/key-metrics-widgets.js` at the time of writing), a new `requiredCustomDimensions` array property should be added to its definition. This array property will contain names of custom dimensions that the tile depends on. In this case, it should only be `googlesitekit_post_categories`.
  - The component should look exactly as its [Figma mock](https://www.figma.com/file/CdtrHB0HAjfGRWTnTMMQI0/Key-Metrics?type=design&node-id=6273-60077&mode=design&t=jVtKY6g6XWmpvybS-4).
  - Its widget slug should be `kmAnalyticsTopCategories` (so that it is consistent with the design doc).
  - The metric tile title should be `Top categories by pageviews`.
  - Its description tooltip should say `Categories that your site visitors viewed the most`.
  - This metric should be dependent on the `analytics-4` module, so it should only be rendered in the key metrics widget area if GA4 is connected, otherwise, `ConnectGA4CTATileWidget` should be rendered (similar to existing GA4-dependent metric tiles). It should also not be shown to view-only users who do not have shared access to GA4.
- The following data should be fetched from the [Google Analytics Data API](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/reporting/data/v1/api-schema) for the global date range selected on the Site Kit dashboard:
  - Metrics: `screenPageViews`
  - Dimensions: `customEvent:googlesitekit_post_categories`
  - The metric should be aggregated so that all pageviews for each category (or set of comma-separated categories) is returned.
  - Order by:  `screenPageViews` descending
- Values:
  - It should be a table pattern metric tile, with the category name(s) showing up as the first column, and `screenPageViews` showing up as the second column.
- The metrics & dimensions used in the reports for this tile should be allow-listed for view-only users.
- This metric should be available for selection in the key metrics selection panel only if the following conditions are met:
  - `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag is enabled.
  - It is not a view-only user.
  - If it is a view-only user, the custom dimension that this metric tile depends on should be available for the connected GA property.

## Implementation Brief

- In `assets/js/googlesitekit/datastore/user/constants.js`:
  - Export a new constant for defining the new widget's slug: `KM_ANALYTICS_TOP_CATEGORIES = 'kmAnalyticsTopCategories'`.
  - Add this constant to the `keyMetricsGA4Widgets` array.
- In `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/key-metrics-widgets.js`:
  - Add a new item for the new widget to the `KEY_METRICS_WIDGETS` object if the `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag is enabled similar to existing widgets.
  - Its `title` & `description` should be according to the ACs.
  - Add a `requiredCustomDimensions` property that should be an array containing the `googlesitekit_post_categories` string.
- In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/widgets/`, create a new `TopCategories.js` component. In this component, use `TopCitiesWidget` as a starting point, then make the following changes:
  - It should use the wrapper component introduced in [#7601](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/issues/7601) so that it can handle the custom dimensions creation and relevant error & loading states.
  - Change relevant variable names accordingly.
  - Use the `customEvent:googlesitekit_post_categories` dimension instead of `city`.
  - Use the `screenPageViews` metric instead of `totalUsers`.
  - The second column of the tile table should render the `screenPageViews` metric value (instead of the `TopCitiesWidget` `totalUsers` percentage).
  - The `title` and `infoTooltip` should be according to the ACs.
- In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/index.js`:
  - Register the new key metric widget the same as other key metric widgets. However, wrap the registration using the new `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag.
- In `includes/Modules/Analytics_4/Report/Request.php`:
  - Update the `validate_shared_dimensions` method and add `customEvent:googlesitekit_post_categories` to the list of valid dimensions.

### Storybook

- Add Storybook stories for the new widget for ready, zero, loading, and error states.

### Test Coverage

- Add VRT scenarios.

## QA Brief

### Setup

* **Site Kit Configuration**: Configure Site Kit using `https://news-key-metrics.instawp.xyz` as the proxy URL. Connect it to the “News Key Metrics” Analytics account. If you don't have access to this domain's GA4 account/property/web datastream, please request access from @nfmohit or @jimmymadon.
* **WordPress Categories**:
   - Create some WordPress categories.
   - Ensure that these categories have the same `term_id` as the `customEvent:googlesitekit_post_categories` custom dimensions.
   - To ascertain the category IDs used for this custom dimension, refer to [GA4 Query Explorer](https://ga-dev-tools.google/ga4/query-explorer/).

### Verification

* Enable the `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag and then configure key metrics.
* Select the "Top categories by pageviews" key metric widget tile from the Metrics selection panel.
* Ensure that the widget tile displays data corresponding to the `customEvent:googlesitekit_post_categories` custom dimension categories.
* Follow the QAB instructions from issue #7601 to confirm the creation of custom dimensions and observe any related errors.

## Changelog entry

* Add “Top categories by pageviews” key metric widget tile.

comment.body:
### QA Update: ✅ 

**Verified:**

- A new component is created for the `Top categories by pageviews` key metric widget tile and is displayed within the Key Metrics Widget area if it is selected in the key metrics selection panel.
- The component looks as its [Figma mock](https://www.figma.com/file/CdtrHB0HAjfGRWTnTMMQI0/Key-Metrics?type=design&node-id=6273-60076&mode=design&t=jVtKY6g6XWmpvybS-4).
- Its widget slug is `kmAnalyticsTopCategories`
- The metric tile title is `Top categories by pageviews`
- Its description tooltip says `Categories that your site visitors viewed the most.
- This metric is dependent on the analytics-4 module.
- The component  is a table pattern metric tile, with the category name(s) showing up as the first column, and `screenPageViews` showing up as the second column.
- The metrics & dimensions are available for view-only users.
- Checked the data compared with Analytics and everything matches.  

Note: we do have a known issue around the [not set] data appearing in the tile and this will be investigated and discussed.

<details>
 <summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/73545194/bfd51fe3-0805-4c2a-a4ec-1aa1f90e369b)
![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/73545194/38f960ce-e225-4628-8ae6-838f7b5bd237)
![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/73545194/8f09bf77-01ff-448f-9d2c-cc8adf33fdd2)
![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/73545194/be2192ee-95d6-40b0-9d51-a01d22e0ee11)
![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/73545194/7d20e6ba-266f-4fb1-933c-03e462dba4dc)

</details>

Bumps [browserify-sign](https://github.com/crypto-browserify/browserify-sign) from 4.0.4 to 4.2.2.
Changelog

Sourced from browserify-sign's changelog.

v4.2.2 - 2023-10-25

Fixed

  • [Tests] log when openssl doesn't support cipher [#37](https://github.com/crypto-browserify/browserify-sign/issues/37)

Commits

  • Only apps should have lockfiles 09a8995
  • [eslint] switch to eslint 83fe463
  • [meta] add npmignore and auto-changelog 4418183
  • [meta] fix package.json indentation 9ac5a5e
  • [Tests] migrate from travis to github actions d845d85
  • [Fix] sign: throw on unsupported padding scheme 8767739
  • [Fix] properly check the upper bound for DSA signatures 85994cd
  • [Tests] handle openSSL not supporting a scheme f5f17c2
  • [Deps] update bn.js, browserify-rsa, elliptic, parse-asn1, readable-stream, safe-buffer a67d0eb
  • [Dev Deps] update nyc, standard, tape cc5350b
  • [Tests] always run coverage; downgrade nyc 75ce1d5

Merged

  • bump elliptic [#58](https://github.com/crypto-browserify/browserify-sign/issues/58)

v4.2.0 - 2020-05-18

Merged

  • switch to safe buffer [#53](https://github.com/crypto-browserify/browserify-sign/issues/53)

v4.1.0 - 2020-05-05

Merged

  • update deps, modernise usage, use readable-stream [#49](https://github.com/crypto-browserify/browserify-sign/issues/49)
Commits

issue.title: Key Metrics HaTS survey triggers
issue.body:
## Summary

<!-- Please reference the issue this PR addresses in the following list. -->

issue.title: Add GA event tracking for Enhanced Measurement.
issue.body:
## Feature Description

GA events should be added to keep track of Enhanced Meaurement interaction for users who have opted into the anonymous usage data reporting.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

The following GA events should be tracked for the given Enhanced Measurement actions. See the [GA events sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1eEuJ2ppVZuai1_hL77RA2vL7DUidM_qCnvTsjxZ_S4k/edit#gid=925918307&range=190:197).

Event Name | Category | Trigger | Condition
-- | -- | -- | --
activate_enhanced_measurement | {viewContext}_analytics |	click | User activates toggle to enable Enhanced Measurement 									
deactivate_enhanced_measurement | {viewContext}_analytics |	click | User deactivates toggle to disable Enhanced Measurement 									
view_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification |	element visibility | Enhanced Measurement activation notification appears on the SK dashboard									
confirm_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification | click | User clicks "Enable now" CTA in the dashboard banner 									
dismiss_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification | click | User clicks "Maybe later" on the banner									
click_learn_more_link | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification |	click | User clicks "Learn more" on the banner									
view_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-success | element visibility | Enhanced Measurement success banner appears on the SK dashboard									
confirm_notification | {viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-success | click | User clicks "OK Got it" CTA in the dashboard banner 									

## Implementation Brief

* In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/common/EnhancedMeasurementSwitch.js`
  * Inside [`handleClick`](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/5aafc62bfa9449790264593dba048da530ee54a7/assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/common/EnhancedMeasurementSwitch.js#L58) callback function, depending if `isEnhancedMeasurementEnabled` is true or false, send `trackEvent` with event `activate_enhanced_measurement` or `deactivate_enhanced_measurement` with category from AC
* In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/dashboard/EnhancedMeasurementActivationBanner/index.js`
  * Add `useMount` hook, since banner will be always be visible on top of the page (in view), when available
    * Check if `! isTooltipVisible` to send `trackEvent` for `view_notification` with category `{viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification`
  * In `handleDismiss` callback, add `trackEvent` for `dismiss_notification` with category from AC
* In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/dashboard/EnhancedMeasurementActivationBanner/SetupBanner.js`
  * Add `trackEvent` for `confirm_notification` and category `{viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-notification`, to the `handleSubmitChanges` callback
  * Add `onLearnMoreClick` prop to the `BannerNotification` component, and create callback function that will send `trackEvent` for `click_learn_more_link ` with category from AC
* In `assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/dashboard/EnhancedMeasurementActivationBanner/SuccessBanner.js`
  * Add `useMount` hook, since this notification will mount only when setup is successful, and be in view (top of the page)
    * add `trackEvent` for `view_notification` with category `{viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-success`
  * In the [`onDismiss`](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/5aafc62bfa9449790264593dba048da530ee54a7/assets/js/modules/analytics-4/components/dashboard/EnhancedMeasurementActivationBanner/SuccessBanner.js#L58-L62) callback block, send `trackEvent` for `confirm_notification` and category `{viewContext}_enhanced-measurement-success`

### Test Coverage

* No test updates needed

## QA Brief

* Follow QA briefs from #7459 and #7461 to get the "Enable enhanced measurement" toggle and the "Enable enhanced measurement" notification banner for your site.
* Ensure your Site Kit settings have "Send Analytics to Google" enabled (either during setup or in the Site Kit Settings).
* Using the Google Analytics Debugger plugin, verify that correct events are tracked as defined in AC.

## Changelog entry

* Add Analytics events for Enhanced Measurement features.

issue.title: Consolidate feature flags for key metrics
issue.body:
## Feature Description

Initially the Key Metrics feature was developed behind the `userInput` feature flag, which has been around for a very long time and was initially a separate independent feature. User input will now be launched with Key Metrics, but so will the new News Key Metrics features which was originally planned to launch separately. Since these will all be launching together, it makes sense to unify them under a single feature flag.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* All use of the `userInput` and `newsKeyMetrics` feature flags should be updated to use a single `keyMetrics` feature flag
	* Care should be taken to only update references to feature flags

## Implementation Brief

* In `feature-flags.json`:
    * Remove `userInput` and `newsKeyMetrics` feature flags.
    * Add the new `keyMetrics` feature flag.
    * Ensure alphabetical order for consistency. 
* In some cases, The check for `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag is redundant and will be true because it is guarded by the `userInput` feature flag. This instances can be removed and can be assumed `true`. Refactor the following files with the aforementioned assumption.
    * `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/key-metrics-widgets.js`
        * Usage in `displayInList` functions. 
    * `assets/js/googlesitekit/datastore/user/key-metrics.js`
        * The `publish_news` case of `getAnswerBasedMetrics` selector. 
    * `assets/js/googlesitekit/datastore/user/key-metrics.test.js`.
        * Remove `should return the correct metrics for the publish_news purpose when the newsKeyMetrics feature is enabled` test case and update the other test. 
* Across the code base, replace the usage of both  `userInput` and  the remaining instances of `newsKeyMetrics` feature flags with the newly introduced `keyMetrics` feature flag.
* Replace the corresponding variable names as well. ie. 
````diff
-    const userInputEnabled = useFeature( 'userInput' );
+    const keyMetricsEnabled = useFeature( 'keyMetrics' );
````
* Update any comments reference to reflect the changes. ie. 
````diff
-        The userInputEnabled check can be removed once the User Input feature is fully launched
+        The keyMetricsEnabled check can be removed once the User Input feature is fully launched
         and we remove this feature flag.
````

### Test Coverage

* Update any failing tests. 

## QA Brief

* The tester plugin should have `keyMetrics` feature flag. Turning this on would work same as the previous `userInput` and `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag enabled together. 
* The  `userInput` and `newsKeyMetrics` feature flags should no longer exist in tester plugin .
* Perform general smoke testing of User Input and Key Metrics (+News Key Metrics) features to ensure no regression were introduced. 

## Changelog entry

* Consolidate feature flags used for Key Metrics.

issue.title: Console Error when Custom Dimensions Metrics Selected While Analytics is Disconnected
issue.body:
## Bug Description

This is a bit of an edge case but I found a console error in a specific scenario. 

On the KMW you have the `Top performing keywords` tile selected (Search Console) and 1 or 2 Analytics tiles.  You therefore have one or two empty tile slots in the widget. Then, Analytics is disconnected, so what appears is the one search console tile and the CTA to connect Analytics in the 1 or 2 Analytics tiles you selected. 

The user then clicks on the 'Add a Metric' tile and then select one with a custom dimension, i.e. `Most popular authors by pageviews` and they go through the oAuth process. When this is completed they are sent back to the dashboard and everything looks fine in that the CTA to connect Analytics increases to take the additional tile selected. 

In Console though an error appears:

issue.title: Add tag configuration to track custom dimensions
issue.body:
## Feature Description

Necessary tag configuration should be added in the `analytics-4` module so that the available custom dimensions for the current GA property are tracked.

The custom dimensions can be tracked by passing an object containing them to the `gtag("config", "G-XXXX")` script, for example:

```js
gtag(
	"config",
	"G-XXXX",
	{
		"googlesitekit_post_type": "page",
		"googlesitekit_post_author": "1",
		"googlesitekit_post_categories": "1,2,3",
		"googlesitekit_post_date": "20220614",
	}
);
```

See relevant section in the design doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1htqStvvyXq_eg5GsHSbdBBgm4Tu_Z6KXsIOBfjWQ5oM/edit?resourcekey=0-Px-yDiCQOTz30DBKllhU3g#heading=h.8rpbnsc62d64).

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

- If the `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag is enabled and the connected GA4 property has available custom dimensions:
  - The tag configuration of the `analytics-4` module should be updated for both web & AMP to track data for the available custom dimensions.
  - The custom dimensions should only be tracked for singular (i.e. [is_singular](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/is_singular/)) templates, i.e. a single page/post should be tracked, but not a blog index or an archive.
  - The `googlesitekit_post_date`, `googlesitekit_post_author`, and `googlesitekit_post_categories` custom dimensions should only be tracked for posts with the `post` post type. This post type should be filterable (using `apply_filters` for example) so that the post type(s) that track these custom dimensions would be flexible.
  - The value for each possible custom dimension (for now) is described below:
    - For `googlesitekit_post_date`: The date, in `YYYYMMDD` format (i.e. what Analytics uses for its date dimension), on which the current WordPress post was published.
    - For `googlesitekit_post_author`: The user ID of the author of the current post, as a string.
    - For `googlesitekit_post_categories`: The categories of the current post as a comma-separated string of IDs of categories.
    - For `googlesitekit_post_type`: Post type of the current post - `post`, `page`, `attachment`, etc.

## Implementation Brief

- In `includes/Modules/Analytics_4.php`, create a new `get_custom_dimensions_data()` method which should do the following:
    * Use the Analytics_4 Settings class (get method) to check the value of the `availableCustomDimensions` for the connected GA property.
    * If there are no custom dimensions within the above setting, return an empty array. 
    * Otherwise, create and apply a new `custom_dimension_valid_post_types` filter with a default value of "post". Call the [`get_post_type()`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_post_type/) WordPress function and check if this value is within the filtered array. If not, return an empty array.
    * Finally, call the `is_singular()` WordPress function. If the value is false, return an empty array.
    * Otherwise, for each of the custom dimensions within the above setting, build an array as follows:
      - Each available custom dimension name should be added to the array as keys.
      - The value for each possible custom dimension key should be added as follows:
        - For `googlesitekit_post_date`: The date on which the current WordPress post was published, obtainable using the [`get_the_date('Ymd')`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_the_date/) WordPress function. This should yield a date in the format similar to what Analytics uses for its date dimension, e.g. `20220614`.
        - For `googlesitekit_post_author`: The user ID of the author of the current post, obtainable using the [`get_the_author_meta('ID')`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_the_author_meta/) WordPress function. The user ID is a non-zero integer value.
        - For `googlesitekit_post_categories`: The categories of the current post, obtainable using the [`get_the_category()`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_the_category/) WordPress function, which returns an array of [`WP_Term`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/classes/wp_term/) objects. The category ID can be accessed by using the `cat_ID` property on each object. This custom dimension value should be a comma-separated list of IDs of categories assigned to a post, e.g. `1, 3, 4, 5`.
        - For `googlesitekit_post_type`: Raw type of the current post, obtainable using the [`get_post_type()`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_post_type/) WordPress function. Example, `post`, `page`, `attachment`, etc.
    * Return this array of dimension keys and values.
- In `includes/Modules/Analytics_4/AMP_Tag.php`:
  * Add a new private property, `custom_dimensions`. 
  * Create a public setter method, called `set_custom_dimensions()` which simply takes in an associative array of custom dimensions and sets it to the above property.
  * Override the `get_tag_config()` method and ensure the shape should look like follows, as also mentioned in the [design doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1htqStvvyXq_eg5GsHSbdBBgm4Tu_Z6KXsIOBfjWQ5oM/edit?resourcekey=0-Px-yDiCQOTz30DBKllhU3g#heading=h.8rpbnsc62d64):
    ```php
    array(
      $this->tag_id => array(
        'groups' => 'default',
        'linker' => array(
          'domains' => array( $this->home_domain ),
        ),
        'googlesitekit_post_author' => 1,
        'googlesitekit_post_categories' => "1,2,3",
        'googlesitekit_post_date' => "20220614",
        'googlesitekit_post_type' => "post"
      ),
    );
    ``` 
- In `includes/Modules/Analytics_4/Web_Tag.php`:
  * Add a new private property, `custom_dimensions`. 
  * Create a public setter method, called `set_custom_dimensions()` which simply takes in an associative array of custom dimensions and sets it to the above property.
  * Similar to the pattern followed within `Analytics/AMP_Tag` and `Analytics_4/AMP_Tag`, extract out the fetching/building of `gtag_opt` out of the `Analytics/Web_Tag::enqueue_gtag_script()` method and override it in `Analytics_4/Web_Tag`. Ensure this method is called consistently when both UA and GA4 are connected, or if only GA4 is connected. (Currently, if UA is enabled, then we do not add config options and do not call the filter correctly within `Analytics_4/Web_Tag::enqueue_gtag_script()`).
- In `includes/Modules/Analytics_4.php`, within the `register_tag()` method, call `get_custom_dimensions_data()` and inside the `can_register()` if block, call the `set_custom_dimensions()` method on `$tag` and pass in the custom dimensions that have been fetched.

### Test Coverage

* Add tests for the `get_custom_dimensions_data()` method. 

## QA Brief

* Follow QAB from #7598 to get custom dimensions configured on your site
* Go to a single post page on your site and verify that custom dimensions added to the gtag config as shown in this ticket description.
* Go to another page that is not a single post and ensure that there is no custom dimensions for that page in the gtag config.
* Also verify that the correct dimensions are passed in the AMP mode and when both UA and GA4 modules are connected.

## Changelog entry

* Add Analytics tag configuration to track custom dimensions for posts.

issue.title: Missing dimension state flickers before loading on dashboard after dimension setup
issue.body:
## Bug Description

From @wpdarren in Bug Bash ([Asana task](https://app.asana.com/0/1205508124049666/1205749590868658/f)):

i’ve just noticed that when I am taken back to the dashboard after logging into my Google account and giving permission for edit scopes, the tiles load as an error state for a second and then load as expected.  Screencast below.

https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/12189958/77ad6326-d333-4385-bc2a-98b31c95fede

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

- The metric tiles that depend on custom dimensions to function should initially render in a loading state, until it is certain that their required dimensions are available, or they are not in the process of being created even if the request has not started yet. In other words, the missing dimension state should only appear if the tile's dimensions are not available, and the creation process has been completed (successfully or not).

issue.title: In View Only context, unavailable custom dimension tile displayed
issue.body:
## Bug Description

From @aaemnnosttv in Bug Bash ([Asana task](https://app.asana.com/0/1205508124049666/1205788136098460/f)):

In a view only context, users can't select or even see any metric tiles that depend on unavailable custom dimensions.

This works as expected in the metric selection panel for the most part, but it is possible for the user's personal choice of metrics to "override" this limitation if it was chosen while GA was connected to a different property where the dimensions existed at the time. This results in a kind of broken experience where the tile renders in the state with a CTA to update the property as clicking the CTA does nothing.

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/12189958/fc862bda-f947-4508-9bfd-862fdef4e402)

The other weird part about this case is that the selection panel only shows 3 selected metrics, but shows 4/4 are selected at the bottom and also shows the warning about needing to update the GA property. There is no way to unselect the custom dimension dependent metric that is hidden.

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/12189958/43153fc3-c716-433f-a750-d8d8e0e57572)

From @nfmohit:

> I think a solution here could be removing any widget slugs that depend on unavailable custom dimensions from KM settings for view-only users, which does sound a bit tricky.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

- For a view-only user, any key metric widget tile that depends on a custom dimension that is not available should have no presence in the dashboard, as if it did not exist (similar to if a widget's module was not shared). This includes:
	- Rendering in the KMW area
	- Rendering in the metric selection panel as well as behavior within (if previously selected somehow, it should not be included in the set of selected metrics, affect selected count, etc)
	- Any non-user-facing side-effects from either of the above

## Implementation Brief

* <!-- One or more bullet points for how to technically resolve the issue. Make sure to include changes to Storybook and visual regression tests where relevant. -->

### Test Coverage

* <!-- One or more bullet points for how to implement automated tests to verify the issue is resolved. -->

## QA Brief

* <!-- One or more bullet points for how to test that the issue has been resolved. -->

## Changelog entry

* <!-- One sentence summarizing the PR, to be used in the changelog. -->

comment.body: Thanks @nfmohit – the AC was a bit too specific about what should change internally and would probably work better as part of an IB – apologies if the direction was unclear. I've updated the AC to move this forward, let me know if you have any questions 👍

issue.title: Add tag configuration to track custom dimensions
issue.body:
## Feature Description

Necessary tag configuration should be added in the `analytics-4` module so that the available custom dimensions for the current GA property are tracked.

The custom dimensions can be tracked by passing an object containing them to the `gtag("config", "G-XXXX")` script, for example:

```js
gtag(
	"config",
	"G-XXXX",
	{
		"googlesitekit_post_type": "page",
		"googlesitekit_post_author": "1",
		"googlesitekit_post_categories": "1,2,3",
		"googlesitekit_post_date": "20220614",
	}
);
```

See relevant section in the design doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1htqStvvyXq_eg5GsHSbdBBgm4Tu_Z6KXsIOBfjWQ5oM/edit?resourcekey=0-Px-yDiCQOTz30DBKllhU3g#heading=h.8rpbnsc62d64).

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

- If the `newsKeyMetrics` feature flag is enabled and the connected GA4 property has available custom dimensions:
  - The tag configuration of the `analytics-4` module should be updated for both web & AMP to track data for the available custom dimensions.
  - The custom dimensions should only be tracked for singular (i.e. [is_singular](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/is_singular/)) templates, i.e. a single page/post should be tracked, but not a blog index or an archive.
  - The `googlesitekit_post_date`, `googlesitekit_post_author`, and `googlesitekit_post_categories` custom dimensions should only be tracked for posts with the `post` post type. This post type should be filterable (using `apply_filters` for example) so that the post type(s) that track these custom dimensions would be flexible.
  - The value for each possible custom dimension (for now) is described below:
    - For `googlesitekit_post_date`: The date, in `YYYYMMDD` format (i.e. what Analytics uses for its date dimension), on which the current WordPress post was published.
    - For `googlesitekit_post_author`: The user ID of the author of the current post, as a string.
    - For `googlesitekit_post_categories`: The categories of the current post as a comma-separated string of IDs of categories.
    - For `googlesitekit_post_type`: Post type of the current post - `post`, `page`, `attachment`, etc.

## Implementation Brief

- In `includes/Modules/Analytics_4.php`, create a new `get_custom_dimensions_data()` method which should do the following:
    * Use the Analytics_4 Settings class (get method) to check the value of the `availableCustomDimensions` for the connected GA property.
    * If there are no custom dimensions within the above setting, return an empty array. 
    * Otherwise, create and apply a new `custom_dimension_valid_post_types` filter with a default value of "post". Call the [`get_post_type()`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_post_type/) WordPress function and check if this value is within the filtered array. If not, return an empty array.
    * Finally, call the `is_singular()` WordPress function. If the value is false, return an empty array.
    * Otherwise, for each of the custom dimensions within the above setting, build an array as follows:
      - Each available custom dimension name should be added to the array as keys.
      - The value for each possible custom dimension key should be added as follows:
        - For `googlesitekit_post_date`: The date on which the current WordPress post was published, obtainable using the [`get_the_date('Ymd')`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_the_date/) WordPress function. This should yield a date in the format similar to what Analytics uses for its date dimension, e.g. `20220614`.
        - For `googlesitekit_post_author`: The user ID of the author of the current post, obtainable using the [`get_the_author_meta('ID')`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_the_author_meta/) WordPress function. The user ID is a non-zero integer value.
        - For `googlesitekit_post_categories`: The categories of the current post, obtainable using the [`get_the_category()`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_the_category/) WordPress function, which returns an array of [`WP_Term`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/classes/wp_term/) objects. The category ID can be accessed by using the `cat_ID` property on each object. This custom dimension value should be a comma-separated list of IDs of categories assigned to a post, e.g. `1, 3, 4, 5`.
        - For `googlesitekit_post_type`: Raw type of the current post, obtainable using the [`get_post_type()`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/get_post_type/) WordPress function. Example, `post`, `page`, `attachment`, etc.
    * Return this array of dimension keys and values.
- In `includes/Modules/Analytics_4/AMP_Tag.php`:
  * Add a new private property, `custom_dimensions`. 
  * Create a public setter method, called `set_custom_dimensions()` which simply takes in an associative array of custom dimensions and sets it to the above property.
  * Override the `get_tag_config()` method and ensure the shape should look like follows, as also mentioned in the [design doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1htqStvvyXq_eg5GsHSbdBBgm4Tu_Z6KXsIOBfjWQ5oM/edit?resourcekey=0-Px-yDiCQOTz30DBKllhU3g#heading=h.8rpbnsc62d64):
    ```php
    array(
      $this->tag_id => array(
        'groups' => 'default',
        'linker' => array(
          'domains' => array( $this->home_domain ),
        ),
        'googlesitekit_post_author' => 1,
        'googlesitekit_post_categories' => "1,2,3",
        'googlesitekit_post_date' => "20220614",
        'googlesitekit_post_type' => "post"
      ),
    );
    ``` 
- In `includes/Modules/Analytics_4/Web_Tag.php`:
  * Add a new private property, `custom_dimensions`. 
  * Create a public setter method, called `set_custom_dimensions()` which simply takes in an associative array of custom dimensions and sets it to the above property.
  * Similar to the pattern followed within `Analytics/AMP_Tag` and `Analytics_4/AMP_Tag`, extract out the fetching/building of `gtag_opt` out of the `Analytics/Web_Tag::enqueue_gtag_script()` method and override it in `Analytics_4/Web_Tag`. Ensure this method is called consistently when both UA and GA4 are connected, or if only GA4 is connected. (Currently, if UA is enabled, then we do not add config options and do not call the filter correctly within `Analytics_4/Web_Tag::enqueue_gtag_script()`).

### Test Coverage

* Add tests for the `get_custom_dimensions_data()` method. 

## QA Brief

* Follow QAB from #7598 to get custom dimensions configured on your site
* Go to a single post page on your site and verify that custom dimensions added to the gtag config as shown in this ticket description.
* Go to another page that is not a single post and ensure that there is no custom dimensions for that page in the gtag config.
* Also verify that the correct dimensions are passed in the AMP mode and when both UA and GA4 modules are connected.

## Changelog entry

* Add Analytics tag configuration to track custom dimensions for posts.

comment.body: Thanks @techanvil, this looks correct to me as well. The issue I flagged to check here was regarding an observation I had with our data plugin before this was added to SK, where the parameters were only being added to the UA tag when both were present, which was a problem. Now we're only seeing them added to the GA4 tag which is fine, since we're only reporting on these with GA4, not to mention UA tagging is being removed entirely soon and probably isn't logging hits for anyone anymore anyways. I also confirmed that the parameters go through as expected when the `config` is using a `GT-` Google Tag ID rather than the GA4 measurement ID 👍

issue.title: Remove Change Metrics link from above Key Metrics Setup CTA
issue.body:
## Feature Description

From @wpdarren in Bug Bash ([Asana task](https://app.asana.com/0/1205508124049666/1205767360235581/f)):

Not specific to NKMW, but noticed this issue on the CTA setup.

Mohit and I feel we have fixed this before, but the change metrics link is appearing on the key metrics CTA. The user hasn't gone through the survey or selected metric tiles via the panel so it shouldn't appear on the setup CTA.

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/12189958/12ee901d-2c7c-475a-ab2e-11f1d5f6c7e8)

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

- The Key Metrics `Change metrics` link should not be displayed when the Key Metrics Setup CTA is visible, i.e. it should only be displayed when there are visible metric tiles in the Key Metrics widget area.

## Implementation Brief

- In `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/ChangeMetricsLink.js`:
  - Update the `renderChangeMetricLink` variable definition so that it returns true if `keyMetrics` is an array **_AND_** its length is greater than zero (currently it is set to OR).

### Test Coverage

- In `assets/js/components/KeyMetrics/ChangeMetricsLink.test.js`:
  - Fix the `should not render if no key metrics are selected` test case to simulate `getKeyMetrics()` returning an empty array. Currently, this selector returns `undefined` in the test case. See [this comment](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/issues/7740#issuecomment-1778952122).
    - This can be fixed by passing an unacceptable value to the user input settings for the `purpose` slug, e.g.:
    ```js
    registry
	    .dispatch( 'core/user' )
	    .setUserInputSetting( 'purpose', [ 'test-purpose' ] );

    ```
## QA Brief

* <!-- One or more bullet points for how to test that the issue has been resolved. -->

## Changelog entry

* <!-- One sentence summarizing the PR, to be used in the changelog. -->

> ### QA Update: ⚠️
> @techanvil @aaemnnosttv when a site has UA and GA4 connected what should I expect to see for a post and page related to the custom dimensions?
> 
> This is what I see for a post ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73545194/278328305-434c3df1-4a40-49ee-8fc4-9414efd1e6fd.png)
> 
> This is what I see for a page ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73545194/278328575-058ff5d9-c264-4716-8be3-d1508823ebe7.png)
> 
> I know Evan mentioned in a stand-up that he felt this wasn't correct, so wanted to check.

Hi @wpdarren, that does look OK to me - we're outputting the [`config`](https://developers.google.com/tag-platform/gtagjs/reference#config) for each of the properties, but only adding the custom dimensions to the config for the GA4 property.

Furthermore the choice of custom dimensions is as per the AC, with `googlesitekit_post_type` being tracked in both cases (for the singular `post` and `page` respectively), but `googlesitekit_post_author`, `googlesitekit_post_date` and `googlesitekit_post_categories` only being tracked for the `post`.

I'm not sure if I might have missed something that @aaemnnosttv has spotted but from my understanding it does seem to be alright.

issue.title: Blank Categories and Author on Custom Dimensions tiles
issue.body:
## Bug Description

As reported by @wpdarren in Bug Bash ([Asana task](https://app.asana.com/0/1205508124049666/1205767360235585/f)):

We noticed that some categories are blank on the custom dimension tiles even though they shouldn't be.   On my live site I have at least one category and author against a post so wouldn't expect to see any blank data. 

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/12189958/6b5abf38-a6ce-401f-a7e7-4786620c399d)

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

- When viewing the "Most popular authors by pageviews" widget tile, no author should be displayed with a blank name.
  - In most cases the author's display name (first & last name, falling back to username) should be displayed.
  - The exception to this is when the author is not found in WordPress (the likely scenario is that it's been deleted), in which case the tracked author ID should be displayed instead.
- When viewing the "Top categories by pageviews" widget tile, no category should be displayed with a blank name.
  - In most cases the category name should be displayed.
  - If the category is not found in WordPress (e.g. it's been deleted), the tracked category ID should be displayed instead.
  - In the unlikely event that no category ID is tracked at all, the fallback text "No category found" should be displayed for the name. This condition should only be reachable if the site has no `category` taxonomy (i.e. the error case for [`wp_get_post_categories`](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/wp_get_post_categories/)).
- Note that the display of the raw author and category IDs may be updated in future via https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/issues/7720.

## Implementation Brief

comment.body:
Please note that I've spent some time investigating this in IB before moving back to AC having determined there is a validly [reachable case](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/7e36531c945151f051d44ae37186fa685090ad85/includes/Modules/Analytics_4.php#L1404-L1406) where the category ID may be tracked as an empty string.

Beyond this, it's worth noting that the issue as originally [reported](https://app.asana.com/0/1205508124049666/1205767360235585/f) by @wpdarren is no longer evident on his live site since updating to the latest `develop`. I've further investigated and found that there are no categories or authors that have been tracked for that site's property with an empty ID, so it looks likely the update to `develop` has brought in a fix.

However @wpdarren did also mention he's potentially seen a blank category on `oi.ie` too - taking a look at the reported data for this site's property it's evident there are empty IDs as seen here. However with `oi.ie` being used heavily for development I think it's quite likely these have been introduced through previous iterations and are not necessary representative of the current state of the codebase.

![image](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/assets/18395600/30204026-4986-485b-9d8d-86df91253193)

So, in conclusion, having realised there _is_ an unlikely but possible scenario for an empty category ID, I've added a point to the AC to address this and have moved it to ACR to get a review of the suggested solution.

Please feel free to assign this back to me once this returns to the IB column.

issue.title: Improve the handling of JS language packs with each plugin update
issue.body:
## Feature Description

With each Site Kit update there can be issues with Site Kit reverting to English, despite no change to the users defined language (ie/ Japanese). This occurs since there is a delay of up to one hour for language packs to be updated with each plugin release. There are more details contained in the below trac ticket:
https://meta.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/6188

To mitigate these incidents, consider an in product or other solution that checks a users site language and whether they have the latest stable version of the language pack for their active SK version. The user could be shown a prompt to download and install the latest language page. 

**Additional context:**  

We don't get a lot of users complaining about this in the support forums, but there are plenty of mentions of these elsewhere, in particular from Japanese users of the plugin. See below examples:
- [Recent Report](https://twitter.com/2525_kana_code/status/1695105430324998596) 
- [Recent Report 2](https://twitter.com/axecom/status/1697070373240775004)
- [Recent Report 3](https://twitter.com/hiro20180901/status/1686333658251341824)

**Temporary workaround:** 
There are a couple of workarounds a user can apply if they find their Site Kit menu items and strings revert to English. These are mentioned below:
- **Workaround 1**: Users can uninstall and reinstall Site Kit once more. This will force updates to the most recent version of the SK language pack for the users defined language
- **Workaround 2** - [Translation Tools](https://wordpress.org/plugins/translation-tools/) or another plugin that update plugins language packs: you can use a plugin to ensure translations will remain in Japanese.
https://wordpress.org/plugins/translation-tools
